channel.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Exclusive live performances and interviews
channel.itunes:author: Download.com Music
channel.description: Looking for great new music? Each week Download.com Music producers and editors Kurt Wolff, Mike Tao, Ariel Nunez, and Peter Gavin host live performances and interviews with our favorite artists, from hip-hop stars like Planet Asia and Lyrics Born to indie-pop icon Lloyd Cole, country singer Taylor Swift, and up-and-comers Street to Nowhere. We talk with them about songwriting, touring, and how they use technology and the Web to navigate their personal and professional lives. And, of course, we listen as they perform an exclusive live show right in our studios.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Live music performances and interviews with hosts Kurt Wolff, Mike Tao, Ariel Nunez, and Peter Gavin.
channel.itunes:summary: Looking for great new music? Each week Download.com Music producers and editors Kurt Wolff, Mike Tao, Ariel Nunez, and Peter Gavin host live performances and interviews with our favorite artists, from hip-hop stars like Planet Asia and Lyrics Born to indie-pop icon Lloyd Cole, country singer Taylor Swift, and up-and-comers Street to Nowhere. We talk with them about songwriting, touring, and how they use technology and the Web to navigate their personal and professional lives. And, of course, we listen as they perform an exclusive live show right in our studios.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Amos Lee
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: On the way to his Fillmore gig, Amos Lee stopped by to share his soulful signing and songwriting. And he tells us why he doesn't mind being the male Norah Jones.
item.itunes:subtitle: Amos Lee
item.itunes:summary: On the way to his Fillmore gig, Amos Lee stopped by to share his soulful signing and songwriting. And he tells us why he doesn't mind being the "male Norah Jones."
item.itunes:author: Amos Lee
item.itunes:keywords: Amos Lee, Blue Note, Last Days at the Lodge, Studio C, Peter Gavin, Mike Tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Raphael Saadiq
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Our guests in Studio C just keep getting stronger--and this week we outdid ourselves, hosting former Tony! Toni! Toné!/Lucy Pearl frontman Raphael Saadiq, who was in town promoting his latest album, The Way I See It. In our exclusive session Saadiq talked about working and hangin’ out with Stevie Wonder, and how the late great J Dilla influenced him musically.
item.itunes:subtitle: Raphael Saadiq
item.itunes:summary: Our guests in Studio C just keep getting stronger--and this week we outdid ourselves, hosting former Tony! Toni! Toné!/Lucy Pearl frontman Raphael Saadiq, who was back in town promoting his latest album, "The Way I See It". In our exclusive session Saadiq talked about working and hangin’ out with Stevie Wonder, and how the late great J Dilla influenced him musically.
item.itunes:author: Raphael Saadiq
item.itunes:keywords: Raphael Saadiq, Tony! Toni! Toné!, The Way I See It, Oh Girl, Studio C, Mike Tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Kardinal Offishall
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Hailing from Toronto, a.k.a. the Tee-Dot, we somehow suckered Konvict Music emcee Kardinal Offishall into hookin' up an interview inside Studio C, while he had a few hours to spare from his tour with Wyclef. Kardi's new single "Dangerous" (feat. Akon) is all over radio and video, and his album Not 4 Sale is set to drop Sept. 9.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kardinal Offishall
item.itunes:summary: Hailing from Toronto, a.k.a. the Tee-Dot, we somehow suckered Konvict Music emcee Kardinal Offishall into hookin' up an interview inside Studio C, while he had a few hours to spare from his tour with Wyclef. Kardi's new single "Dangerous" (feat. Akon) is all over radio and video, and his album Not 4 Sale is set to drop Sept. 9.
item.itunes:author: Kardinal Offishall
item.itunes:keywords: Kardinal Offishall, Dangerous, Not 4 Sale, Konvict Music, Akon, Studio C, Ariel Nunez, Mike Nice

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Far*East Movement
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Los Angeles hip-hop collective Far*East Movement stopped by Studio C recently to fill us in on their upcoming release, Animal. They also broke down the origin of their name, the different perceptions of being an Asian hip-hop act, and how their parents have reacted to their career paths.
item.itunes:subtitle: Far*East Movement
item.itunes:summary: Los Angeles hip-hop collective Far*East Movement stopped by Studio C recently to fill us in on their upcoming release, "Animal". They also broke down the origin of their name, the different perceptions of being an Asian hip-hop act, and how their parents have reacted to their career paths.
item.itunes:author: Far*East Movement
item.itunes:keywords: Far*East Movement, Catch Music, Lowridin', You've Got A Friend, Studio C, Ariel Nunez, Mike Nice

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Radar Bros.
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Radar Bros. make pretty country-folk ditties that show their attachment to lo-fi folk without bogging them down by the genre's self-seriousness. Listen to our exclusive live performance and interview with frontman Jim Putnam and the gang.
item.itunes:subtitle: Radar Bros.
item.itunes:summary: Radar Bros. make pretty country-folk ditties that show their attachment to lo-fi folk without bogging them down by the genre's self-seriousness. Listen to our exclusive live performance and interview with frontman Jim Putnam and the gang.
item.itunes:author: Radar Bros.
item.itunes:keywords: Radar Bros., Merge Records, Auditorium, Studio C, Peter Gavin

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Raashan Ahmad
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Crown City Rockers emcee Raashan Ahmad is this week's Studio C guest. Besides busting a fresh a capella freestyle for us, Raashan talks about the state of hip-hop today and what he wanted to achieve with his debut solo album The Push on OM Records.
item.itunes:subtitle: Raashan Ahmad
item.itunes:summary: Crown City Rockers emcee Raashan Ahmad is this week's Studio C guest. Besides busting a fresh a capella freestyle for us, Raashan talks about the state of hip-hop today and what he wanted to achieve with his debut solo album "The Push" on OM Records.
item.itunes:author: Raashan Ahmad
item.itunes:keywords: Raashan Ahmad,The Push, OM Records, Crown City Rockers, Studio C, Mike Nice

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Akron/Family
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: As "well-mannered" as Akron/Family is in person, their music remains impossible to compartmentalize. But that's not to say their mix of gentle folk harmonies and free-form grooviness isn't knockout beautiful. See what we mean as they chat about their latest album, Love Is Simple, and play low-key acoustic versions of three songs live during our latest Studio C podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Akron/Family
item.itunes:summary: As "well-mannered" as Akron/Family is in person, their music remains impossible to compartmentalize. But that's not to say their mix of gentle folk harmonies and free-form grooviness isn't knockout beautiful. See what we mean as they chat about their latest album, "Love Is Simple", and play low-key acoustic versions of three songs live during our latest Studio C podcast.
item.itunes:author: Akron/Family
item.itunes:keywords: Akron/Family, Love Is Simple, Young God Records, Studio C, Kurt Wolff,

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Jim Lauderdale
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Looks like 2008 is another banner year for Jim Lauderdale. Repeating his '06 agenda he's again released not one but two new CDs, Honey Songs and The Bluegrass Diaries. To honor his achievements, we dug into the Studio C archives and unearthed this exclusive podcast, where Jim chatted about songwriting and played four acoustic songs live in our studio.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jim Lauderdale
item.itunes:summary: Looks like 2008 is another banner year for Jim Lauderdale. Repeating his '06 agenda he's again released not one but "two" new CDs, "Honey Songs" and "The Bluegrass Diaries". To honor his achievements, we dug into the Studio C archives and unearthed this exclusive podcast, where Jim chatted about songwriting and played four acoustic songs live in our studio.
item.itunes:author: Jim Lauderdale
item.itunes:keywords: Jim Lauderdale, Yep Roc, Bluegrass,Country Super Hits Vol. 1, Studio C, Kurt Wolff, Peter Gavin

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Orgone
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Members of L.A.-based funk collective Orgone are this week's Studio C guests. They've got a new release, The Killion Floor, in stores now, and it should please fans of Breakestra, Connie Price, and Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings because most of the members are affiliated with those bands as well. During the podcast they explain the zany origin of their name and pick cover songs to perform; we also listen to album cuts including It's What You Do and Who Knows Who.
item.itunes:subtitle: Orgone
item.itunes:summary: Members of L.A.-based funk collective Orgone are this week's Studio C guests. They've got a new release, "The Killion Floor", in stores now, and it should please fans of Breakestra, Connie Price, and Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings because most of the members are affiliated with those bands as well. During the podcast they explain the zany origin of their name and pick cover songs to perform; we also listen to album cuts including "It's What You Do" and "Who Knows Who."
item.itunes:author: Orgone
item.itunes:keywords: Orgone, Studio C, Breakestra, Connie Price, Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings, Dakah Hip-Hop Orchestra, The Killion Fields, Mike Nice, Peter Gavin

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Mark Kozelek
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: With a new Sun Kil Moon LP, as well as Retribution Gospel Choir's debut album (which he produced), a book, and a movie score all coming out this year, it's safe to say Mark Kozelek is a "prolific artist." He sat down with us for a rare interview (he doesn't do them often) to discuss all his projects and play some new songs.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark Kozelek
item.itunes:summary: With a new Sun Kil Moon LP, as well as Retribution Gospel Choir's debut album (which he produced), a book, and a movie score all coming out this year, it's safe to say Mark Kozelek is a "prolific artist." He sat down with us for a rare interview (he doesn't do them often) to discuss all his projects and play some new songs.
item.itunes:author: Mark Kozelek
item.itunes:keywords: Mark Kozelek, Sun Kil Moon, Retribution Gospel Choir, Peter Gavin

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Mark Eitzel
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: American Music Club is back in action with a new album, The Golden Age, as well as a spring 2008 North American tour. To get you in the spirit, we dug into the Studio C archives to unearth this 2006 performance and interview featuring AMC bandleader Mark Eitzel.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark Eitzel
item.itunes:summary: American Music Club is back in action with a new album, "The Golden Age", as well as a spring 2008 North American tour. To get you in the spirit, we dug into the Studio C archives to unearth this 2006 performance and interview featuring AMC bandleader Mark Eitzel.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Lyrics Born
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: We've got another Studio C flashback for ya. For this week's podcast, the spotlight is once again on Bay Area homeboy Lyrics Born, who's now signed to ANTI- and has a new album Everywhere At Once, in stores now.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lyrics Born
item.itunes:summary: We've got another Studio C flashback for ya. For this week's podcast, the spotlight is once again on Bay Area homeboy Lyrics Born, who's now signed to ANTI- and has a new album "Everywhere At Once", in stores now.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Tift Merritt
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter Tift Merritt stopped by Studio C to talk about country vs. soul, Paris vs. North Carolina, and Robert Frank vs. George Drakoulias. She also played three songs from her brand-new album, Another Country.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tift Merritt
item.itunes:summary: Tift Merritt Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter Tift Merritt stopped by Studio C to talk about country vs. soul, Paris vs. North Carolina, and Robert Frank vs. George Drakoulias. She also played three songs from her brand-new album, "Another Country".
item.itunes:author: Tift Merritt
item.itunes:keywords: CNET, Studio C, Tift Merritt, Another Country, Kurt Wolff

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Tommy Guerrero
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Former pro skater Tommy Guerrero stopped by Studio C last week to promote his latest CD, Return of the Bastard. Along with telling skating tour stories, talking about Amy Winehouse, and breaking down his term "fatinum," Tommy got down on his guitar and strummed a few tunes for us, too.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tommy Guerrero
item.itunes:summary: Former pro skater Tommy Guerrero stopped by Studio C last week to promote his latest CD, "Return of the Bastard". item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Liam Finn
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: The young New Zealand singer-songwriter (and son of Neil Finn from Crowded House) stopped by Studio C recently to talk about songwriting and touring and play a few fantastic songs from his solo debut album, I'll Be Lightning.
item.itunes:subtitle: Liam Finn
item.itunes:summary: The young New Zealand singer-songwriter (and son of Neil Finn from Crowded House) stopped by Studio C recently to talk about songwriting and touring and play a few fantastic songs from his solo debut album, "I'll Be Lightning".

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Barton Carroll
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Singer, songwriter, and onetime Crooked Fingers bandmember Barton Carroll stopped by Studio C to play songs from his latest album The Lost One and talk about the genius of Peter Lorre and seeing Doc Watson play in a vacuum-cleaner store.
item.itunes:subtitle: Barton Carroll
item.itunes:summary: Singer, songwriter, and onetime Crooked Fingers bandmember Barton Carroll stopped by Studio C to play songs from his latest album "The Lost One" and talk about the genius of Peter Lorre and seeing Doc Watson play in a vacuum-cleaner store.

item.itunes:keywords: CNET, Studio C, Barton Carroll, The Lost One, Skybucket, Kurt Wolff

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Chuck Prophet
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Between producing Kelly Willis, writing songs with Dan Penn, and landing a track on a recent Heart album, Chuck Prophet has been heavily in demand lately. He stopped by Studio C to talk about his adventures and play a few songs from his brand-new album, Soap and Water.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chuck Prophet
item.itunes:summary: Between producing Kelly Willis, writing songs with Dan Penn, and landing a track on a recent Heart album, Chuck Prophet has been heavily in demand lately. He stopped by Studio C to talk about his adventures and play a few songs from his brand-new album, "Soap and Water".
item.itunes:author: Chuck Prophet
item.itunes:keywords: Chuck Prophet, Soap and Water, Studio C, Kurt Wolff, Mike Tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Hurricane Chris
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: He may only be 18 years old, but Louisana rapper Hurricane Chris has already sold a record 3 million ringtones for his smash hit single A Bay Bay. We have no idea how he got stuck with us inside Studio C, but he was kind enough to talk about his debut album, 51/50 Ratchet, and school us on where the term A Bay Bay comes from.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hurricane Chris
item.itunes:summary: He may only be 18 years old, but Louisana rapper Hurricane Chris has already sold a record 3 million ringtones for his smash hit single "A Bay Bay". We have no idea how he got stuck with us inside Studio C, but he was kind enough to talk about his debut album, 51/50 Ratchet, and school us on where the term A Bay Bay comes from.
item.itunes:author: Hurricane Chris
item.itunes:keywords: Hurricane Chris, J Records, A Bay Bay, 51/50 Ratchet, Polo Grounds Music, Studio C, Ariel Nunez, D2S, Mike Nice

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: John Ralston
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: While on tour with labelmate Dashboard Confessional, John Ralston stopped by CNET to share unplugged tracks from his latest album Sorry Vampire. He performed an exclusive bonus track--for all the Ralston-heads out there.
item.itunes:subtitle: John Ralston
item.itunes:summary: While on tour with labelmate Dashboard Confessional, John Ralston stopped by CNET to share unplugged tracks from his latest album "Sorry Vampire". He performed an exclusive bonus track--for all the Ralston-heads out there.

item.itunes:keywords: John Ralston, Studio C, Peter Gavin, Mike Tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Mekons
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Touring in support of new album Natural , three members of legendary post-punk band the Mekons ( Jon Langford, Lu Edmonds , and Steve Goulding ) stopped by Studio C for a rousing, stripped-down three-song set.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mekons
item.itunes:summary: Touring in support of new album "Natural", three members of legendary post-punk band the Mekons (Jon Langford, Lu Edmonds, and Steve Goulding) stopped by Studio C for a rousing, stripped-down three-song set.

item.itunes:keywords: Mekons, Bloodshot Records, Waco Brothers, Sally Timms, Jon Langford, Rico Bell, Pine Valley Cosmonauts, Studio C, Kurt Wolff, Mike Tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Rahsaan Patterson
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Soulful crooner Rahsaan Patterson is this week's guest in Studio C. The former Kids Incorporated star shares his experiences working on the show when he was younger, and how that helped groom him for a music career. He just released a new album, Wines and Spirits, and you can hear his latest single Higher Love--along with an old favorite, Burnin--in this exclusive session.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rahsaan Patterson
item.itunes:summary: Soulful crooner Rahsaan Patterson is this week's guest in Studio C. The former Kids Incorporated star shares his experiences working on the show when he was younger, and how that helped groom him for a music career. He just released a new album, Wines and Spirits, and you can hear his latest single "Higher Love"--along with an old favorite, "Burnin"--in this exclusive session.
item.itunes:author: Rahsaan Patterson
item.itunes:keywords: Rahsaan Patterson, Artistry Records, Wines and Spirits, Studio C, Ariel Nunez, Mike Nice, D2S

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Josh Rouse
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Seventies rock-inspired ladies' man Josh Rouse found a few minutes out of his busy tour schedule to stop by Studio C. He treated us to solo acoustic versions of "Hollywood Bass Player" and "Sweetie" from his latest album, Country Mouse City House.
item.itunes:subtitle: Josh Rouse
item.itunes:summary: Seventies rock-inspired ladies' man Josh Rouse found a few minutes out of his busy tour schedule to stop by Studio C. He treated us to solo acoustic versions of "Hollywood Bass Player" and "Sweetie" from his latest album, Country Mouse City House.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Jessi Malay
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: We were lucky to land a Studio C interview with the lovely Warner Brothers artist Jessi Malay, and we didn't waste any time asking about her latest single Bootie Bangs (featuring Yung Joc), her debut solo album, guest features, and, um, her secret crush.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jessi Malay
item.itunes:summary: We were lucky to land a Studio C interview with the lovely Warner Brothers artist Jessi Malay, and we didn't waste any time asking about her latest single Bootie Bangs (featuring Yung Joc), her debut solo album, guest features, and, um, her secret crush.

item.itunes:keywords: Jessi Malay, Bootie Bangs, Yung Joc, Warner Bros., Studio C, Ariel Nunez, Mike Nice, Distortion2Static

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Taylor Swift
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: For this archive edition of Studio C, we revisit a 2006 interview with country star Taylor Swift . She performs her hit single "Tim McGraw" from her self-titled debut, which has since gone platinum and won her CMA and ACM nominations and CMT's Breakthrough Video of the Year award.
item.itunes:subtitle: Taylor Swift
item.itunes:summary: For this archive edition of Studio C, we revisit a 2006 interview with country star Taylor Swift. She performs her hit single "Tim McGraw" from her self-titled debut, which has since gone platinum and won her CMA and ACM nominations and CMT's Breakthrough Video of the Year award.
item.itunes:author: Taylor Swift
item.itunes:keywords: Taylor Swift, Tim McGraw, Country, Big Machine, Teardrops

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Oakley Hall
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: On brand-new CD I'll Follow You, Brooklyn-based indie act Oakley Hall plays a mixture of rock, drone, country, and fuzz. In this archive edition of Studio C, bandmembers Pat Sullivan, Claudia Mogel, and Rachel Cox stop by for a rare acoustic performance.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oakley Hall
item.itunes:summary: On brand-new CD I'll Follow You, Brooklyn-based indie act Oakley Hall plays a mixture of rock, drone, country, and fuzz. In this archive edition of Studio C, bandmembers Pat Sullivan, Claudia Mogel, and Rachel Cox stop by for a rare acoustic performance.

item.itunes:keywords: Oakley Hall, Oneida, Papa Crazee, Warlock, Kristofferson, Spacemen 3, psychedelia, folk, freak

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Ferraby Lionheart
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Koreatown's nattily named Lionheart finds a middle ground between the baroque L.A. pop of Aimee Mann and the canyon music of freak-folkers Banhart and Georgeson. Check out our exclusive live performance and interview with Ferraby in Studio C.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ferraby Lionheart
item.itunes:summary: Koreatown's nattily named Lionheart finds a middle ground between the baroque L.A. pop of Aimee Mann and the canyon music of freak-folkers Banhart and Georgeson. Check out our exclusive live performance and interview with Ferraby in Studio C.
item.itunes:author: Ferraby Lionheart
item.itunes:keywords: ferraby lionheart, catch the brass ring, cnet, mp3, download, studio c, peter gavin, mike tao

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Matt Nathanson
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Pulling out an oldie but goodie from our bag of archived sessions, we resurrect a 2006 Studio C podcast featuring singer/songwriter Matt Nathanson, who just released a brand new album, Some Mad Hope. Besides performing a few tracks, including a Springsteen cover, Matt chats about his music on Dawson's Creek and a tour with Pink, and even offers a lil' geeky tech talk for ya.
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt Nathanson
item.itunes:summary: Pulling out an oldie but goodie from our bag of archived sessions, we resurrect a 2006 Studio C podcast featuring singer/songwriter Matt Nathanson, who just released a brand new album, Some Mad Hope. item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Allen Jay
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: He resides in the Bay Area, but new-school MC Allen Jay has worldwide appeal written all over him. He's been compared to former Bad Boy rapper Mase, but Jay was eager to showcase his skills in Studio C and prove he has a style all his own.
item.itunes:subtitle: Allen Jay
item.itunes:summary: He resides in the Bay Area, but new-school MC Allen Jay has worldwide appeal written all over him. He's been compared to former Bad Boy rapper Mase, but Jay was eager to showcase his skills in Studio C and prove he has a style all his own.

item.itunes:keywords: Allen Jay, Young and Famous, Hyphy, M1 Promo, Brand New, Studio C, Ariel Nunez, Distortion2Static, Mike Nice,

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: U.S.D.A.
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Their debut album is entitled Cold Summer but Corporate Thugz Entertainment/Def Jam collective U.S.D.A. were servin' up nothin' but heat inside Studio C. Group members Blood Raw and Slick Pulla talk shop about their affiliation with multiplatinum rapper Young Jeezy and what to expect from them in the near future.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Planet Asia
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: This week we serve up a throwback edition from Studio C featuring Fresno MC Planet Asia, who just released a new album, Jewelry Box Sessions. Besides rippin' a few freestyles, not to be missed is Asia's, um, interesting outlook women, as well as his feelings on fake gangsta rappers.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Let's Go Sailing
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: We caught up with Shana Levy and her band while they were on tour through San Francisco, hot off their debut release The Chaos In Order. Join us for an exclusive live acoustic session with the group, in this week's Studio C podcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Let's Go Sailing
item.itunes:summary: We caught up with Shana Levy and her band while they were on tour through San Francisco, hot off their debut release The Chaos In Order. Join us for an exclusive live acoustic session with the group, in this week's Studio C podcast.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Tom Heyman
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Guitarist, singer, and songwriter Tom Heyman is our guest in Studio C this week. Formerly lead guitarist with Philly-based rock 'n' roll band Go To Blazes, he's successfully transitioned into a powerful songwriter and singer on his own, with two albums and numerous studio and touring creds (Alejandro Escovedo, Chuck Prophet, Court and Spark) to his name. He talks about writing and recording and plays three songs from his latest album, "Deliver Me."
item.itunes:subtitle: Tom Heyman
item.itunes:summary: Guitarist, singer, and songwriter Tom Heyman is our guest in Studio C this week. Formerly lead guitarist with Philly-based rock 'n' roll band Go To Blazes, he's successfully transitioned into a powerful songwriter and singer on his own, with two albums and numerous studio and touring creds (Alejandro Escovedo, Chuck Prophet, Court and Spark) to his name. He talks about writing and recording and plays three songs from his latest album, "Deliver Me."
item.itunes:author: Tom Heyman

Between songs she gives us her outlook on the Bay Area music scene and drops hints on what to expect from her upcoming album.

item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com

Besides blessing us with several a cappella freestyles, Phat Kat discusses his experiences with his good friend, the late J Dilla, hip-hop in Detroit, and what to expect from his latest release "Carte Blanche".

item.description: With an influence in folk, jazz, and bittersweet rock, Robert Gomez makes the growing list of indie stars from Denton, Texas. He and his cellist stopped by our studio to perform and share stories about music, and what it's like to be in the circus.

item.description: In our latest Studio C podcast, we get a chance to experience the eclectic and refreshing style of Quannum Projects artist Pigeon John. In addition to reminiscing about his first hip-hop experience and his struggles to get signed, PJ displays his skillz on the mic and performs cuts off his latest album "Pigeon John and the Summertime Pool Party".

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: A-Plus
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Souls of Mischief/Hieroglyphics member A-Plus is this week's guest in Studio C. Besides promoting and performing tracks off his debut album "My Last Good Deed", 'Pleezee' breaks down the major differences between major and indie labels, how to avoid getting socked in the face by a hip-hop artist, and how the Souls of Mischief almost made a pop album.
item.itunes:subtitle: A-Plus

item.description: In between tour dates and studio recording, Quannum Projects artist Lyrics Born stopped by Studio C to talk about his upcoming projects, crate digging, and the evolution of hip-hop. Even without labelmate Lateef, LB flawlessly performed one of Latryx's classic singles "Lady Don't Tek No."

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Nicole Atkins
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: With loud rock blaring 24/7 in Austin all week, it was refreshing to mellow out a bit with Nicole Atkins and her rootsy antifolk quintet. We were lucky enough to sit down and chat with her for this exclusive interview and performance. Warning: these melodies will get stuck in your head--in a good way!
item.itunes:subtitle: Nicole Atkins
item.itunes:summary: With loud rock blaring 24/7 in Austin all week, it was refreshing to mellow out a bit with Nicole Atkins and her rootsy antifolk quintet. item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Clyde Carson
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Recently signed to Capitol/Black Wall Street/Moe Doe Records, the Bay Area's Clyde Carson stopped by to promote and perform his new single "2 Step" live in Studio C. In addition to promoting his upcoming album, Clyde also spoke about his latest business ventures, and cleared up the confusion about who actually produced "2 Step."
item.itunes:subtitle: Clyde Carson

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Damien Jurado
item.author: Kurt.Wolff@cnet.com
item.description: Many say you should only listen to Damien Jurado's music through headphones. That makes sense--it's the best way to catch the subtleties of his music, which is at once mournful and curiously uplifting. Not sure what we mean? Hear for yourself during this week's Studio C session, as Jurado performs two brand-new songs (and one recent favorite) with just his voice and guitar.
item.itunes:subtitle: Damien Jurado
item.itunes:summary: Many say you should only listen to Damien Jurado's music through headphones. That makes sense--it's the best way to catch the subtleties of his music, which is at once mournful and curiously uplifting. Not sure what we mean? item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: This week, Studio C presents singer, songwriter, and keyboardist Vienna Teng. She discusses songwriting methods, her early success with online promotion, and her brand-new album "Dreaming Through the Noise," just out on Rounder/Zoe Records.
item.itunes:subtitle: Vienna Teng

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Sir Richard Bishop
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: The Sun City Girls guitarist and filmmaker plays lightning-fast, Gypsy-inspired instrumentals and acoustic experiments (such as merging the Beatles' "Nowhere Man" with "Somewhere Over the Rainbow"). He discusses idol/inspiration John Fahey and editing his films on iMovie.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sir Richard Bishop

item.itunes:author: Sir Richard Bishop
item.itunes:keywords: Sun City Girls, Sir Richard Bishop, John Fahey, guitar, flamenco, gypsy, jodorowsky

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Oakley Hall
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: The Brooklyn-based, indie-roots act Oakley Hall plays a mixture of folk, drone, country, and fuzz. Bandleader Pat Sullivan, formerly of Oneida, stops by Studio C with cohorts Claudia Mogel and Rachel Cox for a rare acoustic performance.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oakley Hall

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Lloyd Cole
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: Best known for his '80s hits with the Commotions and mid-'90s solo work, the English singer/songwriter performs a brand new song for the first time, along with "2cv" from Rattlesnakes and "Undressed" from his first solo record.

item.title: Music Sessions from Studio C: Matt Nathanson
item.author: Nick.Tangborn@cnet.com
item.description: Matt Nathanson is this week's music guest. The singer/songwriter performs "Bulletproof Weeks" and Bruce Springsteen's "Brilliant Disguise." Nathanson discusses his upcoming summer tour with Pink, his new live album "At The Point," as well as the reason he switched from PC to Mac.
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt Nathanson

Nathanson discusses his upcoming summer tour with Pink, his new live album "At The Point," as well as the reason he switched from PC to Mac.
